text: Kotohira-gu Worship hall of the main shrine Affiliation Shinto Shown within Japan Geographic coordinates 34°11′03″N 133°48′35″E﻿ / ﻿34.18417°N 133.80972°E﻿ / 34.18417; 133.80972Coordinates: 34°11′03″N 133°48′35″E﻿ / ﻿34.18417°N 133.80972°E﻿ / 34.18417; 133.80972 Glossary of Shinto (also known as , , or Konpira Shrine in English) is a Shinto shrine in the town of Kotohira in Kagawa, Japan. This shrine is dedicated to the safety of ships and sailors. It is a Kotohira shrine dedicated to Ōmononushi. It is a very popular pilgrimage spot. Before the Meiji era, Kotohira Shrine was also a Buddhist site. == Related pages == * List of Shinto shrines in Japan == Notes == == Other websites == * Kotohira-gū official website * Guide to Kotohira-gū on Japan- guide.com * 1179961756 Kotohira-gū on OpenStreetMap Category:Kokuhei Chūsha Category:Former Beppyo shrines Category:Kotohira shrines Category:Kagawa Prefecture
title: Kotohira-gū
